title: 111_hr5750
content:
The "FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010" mandates an increase in the number of Federal air marshals by at least 1,750 for inbound international flights by September 30, 2012. The goal is to maintain a presence on domestic flights while enhancing security. Training of Federal air marshals is also emphasized. The "FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010" requires new Federal air marshals to complete criminal investigative training at the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center. Existing employees who have already completed the training are exempt. Alternative training options must be available within 3 years of the Act's enactment. The FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010 mandates that air marshals hired before the enactment date must attend an alternative training program to bridge the gap between basic police training and criminal investigative training. The Director of the Federal Law Enforcement Center will determine the program, which must meet the standards of the criminal investigative training program. The FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010 allocates $3,000,000 for fiscal years 2011 and 2012 for a specific subsection. This subsection does not reclassify Federal air marshals as criminal investigators. OMBUDSMAN. The FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010 allocates funds for an Office of the Ombudsman within the Federal Air Marshal Service to address morale, training, and quality of life issues. The Ombudsman will implement recommendations from the Inspector General and Comptroller General. The FAMS Augmentation Act of 2010 allocates $1,000,000 for the Office of the Ombudsman within the Federal Air Marshal Service for fiscal years 2011 and 2012. SEC. 5. REPORTS.

Beginning on December 31st of 2010 and every 6 months thereafter, the Assistant Secretary must submit a report to the House Committee on Homeland Security and the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation on the progress of increasing Federal air marshals, adopting a criminal investigative training program, and implementing an ombudsman program. The report will also detail disciplinary actions against marshals and complaints or lawsuits filed by them.

SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2011 and 2012 is set at $190,000,000 and $172,000,000 respectively.
